text:
I think ^ and * really should be defined consistently. Here that means `sin*sin == sin^2`, or at least those functions evaluate to the equivalent value at all points. But I think using * to mean composition is a bad idea, and same for ^. 
I would be happy not to inherit the inconsistency been sin^-1 (the meaning sought after here) and sin^2 (compose sin and square) in standard math notation.

But it would be nice to have an operator for iterated composition, completed for negative integers.
Most functions are not invertible so it could not be completed for negative integers in general

There is the already defined `\circle` operator that does function composition, so while it isn't as nice for longer strings you can do something like:
```julia> f(x) = x+1
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> (f∘f∘f∘f)(3)
7```
